channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Inductive Graph Unlearning
item.description: To extend machine unlearning to graph data, \textit{GraphEraser} has been proposed.

item.title: Unconstrained Parametrization of Dissipative and Contracting Neural Ordinary Differential Equations
item.description: We validate the properties of NodeRENs, including the possibility of handling irregularly sampled data, in a case study in nonlinear system identification.

item.title: Graph Mixture of Experts: Learning on Large-Scale Graphs with Explicit Diversity Modeling
item.description: Additionally, GMoE includes information aggregation experts with varying aggregation hop sizes, where the experts with larger hop sizes are specialized in capturing information over longer ranges.

item.title: NTK-SAP: Improving neural network pruning by aligning training dynamics
item.description: Recent advances in neural tangent kernel (NTK) theory suggest that the training dynamics of large enough neural networks is closely related to the spectrum of the NTK.

item.title: A Fast and Lightweight Network for Low-Light Image Enhancement
item.description: To achieve efficient low-light image enhancement, we recognize the challenges of the lack of an absolute reference and the need for a large receptive field to obtain global contrast.

item.title: Simplifying Content-Based Neural News Recommendation: On User Modeling and Training Objectives
item.description: Most neural news recommenders rely on user click behavior and typically introduce dedicated user encoders that aggregate the content of clicked news into user embeddings (early fusion).

item.title: Efficient SAGE Estimation via Causal Structure Learning
item.description: We propose $d$-SAGE, a method that accelerates SAGE approximation.

item.title: The Concept of Forward-Forward Learning Applied to a Multi Output Perceptron
item.description: The concept of a recently proposed Forward-Forward learning algorithm for fully connected artificial neural networks is applied to a single multi output perceptron for classification.

item.title: MemeFier: Dual-stage Modality Fusion for Image Meme Classification
item.description: Hate speech is a societal problem that has significantly grown through the Internet.

item.title: Towards an Effective and Efficient Transformer for Rain-by-snow Weather Removal
item.description: Rain-by-snow weather removal is a specialized task in weather-degraded image restoration aiming to eliminate coexisting rain streaks and snow particles.

item.title: Super-Resolving Face Image by Facial Parsing Information
item.description: In this paper, we build a novel parsing map guided face super-resolution network which extracts the face prior (i. e., parsing map) directly from low-resolution face image for the following utilization.

item.title: GIF: A General Graph Unlearning Strategy via Influence Function
item.description: Then, we recognize the crux to the inability of traditional influence function for graph unlearning, and devise Graph Influence Function (GIF), a model-agnostic unlearning method that can efficiently and accurately estimate parameter changes in response to a $\epsilon$-mass perturbation in deleted data.

item.title: Visual Dependency Transformers: Dependency Tree Emerges from Reversed Attention
item.description: When looking at an image, we can decompose the scene into entities and their parts as well as obtain the dependencies between them.

item.title: VLPD: Context-Aware Pedestrian Detection via Vision-Language Semantic Self-Supervision
item.description: Firstly, we propose a self-supervised Vision-Language Semantic (VLS) segmentation method, which learns both fully-supervised pedestrian detection and contextual segmentation via self-generated explicit labels of semantic classes by vision-language models.

item.title: Making AI Less "Thirsty": Uncovering and Addressing the Secret Water Footprint of AI Models
item.description: The growing carbon footprint of artificial intelligence (AI) models, especially large ones such as GPT-3 and GPT-4, has been undergoing public scrutiny.

item.title: DiffMimic: Efficient Motion Mimicking with Differentiable Physics
item.description: Motion mimicking is a foundational task in physics-based character animation.

item.title: On the Pareto Front of Multilingual Neural Machine Translation
item.description: Based on our observations, we propose the Double Power Law to predict the unique performance trade-off front in MNMT, which is robust across various languages, data adequacy and number of tasks.

item.title: Mask Detection and Classification in Thermal Face Images
item.description: Face masks are recommended to reduce the transmission of many viruses, especially SARS-CoV-2.

item.title: InterFormer: Real-time Interactive Image Segmentation
item.description: Second, the model has to repeatedly process the image, the annotator's current click, and the model's feedback of the annotator's former clicks at each step of interaction, resulting in redundant computations.

item.title: Uncurated Image-Text Datasets: Shedding Light on Demographic Bias
item.description: The increasing tendency to collect large and uncurated datasets to train vision-and-language models has raised concerns about fair representations.

item.title: Exploiting the Complementarity of 2D and 3D Networks to Address Domain-Shift in 3D Semantic Segmentation
item.description: 3D semantic segmentation is a critical task in many real-world applications, such as autonomous driving, robotics, and mixed reality.

item.title: Geometric-aware Pretraining for Vision-centric 3D Object Detection
item.description: We also conduct experiments on various image backbones and view transformations to validate the efficacy of our approach.

item.title: Multi-task learning for tissue segmentation and tumor detection in colorectal cancer histology slides
item.description: Automating tissue segmentation and tumor detection in histopathology images of colorectal cancer (CRC) is an enabler for faster diagnostic pathology workflows.

item.title: Micron-BERT: BERT-based Facial Micro-Expression Recognition
item.description: By incorporating these components into an end-to-end deep network, the proposed $\mu$-BERT significantly outperforms all previous work in various micro-expression tasks.

item.title: RFAConv: Innovating Spatital Attention and Standard Convolutional Operation
item.description: In this paper, we explain the effectiveness of spatial attention from a new perspective, it is that the spatial attention mechanism essentially solves the problem of convolutional kernel parameter sharing.

item.title: SegGPT: Segmenting Everything In Context
item.description: We unify various segmentation tasks into a generalist in-context learning framework that accommodates different kinds of segmentation data by transforming them into the same format of images.

item.title: UNICORN: A Unified Backdoor Trigger Inversion Framework
item.description: Then, it proposes a unified framework to invert backdoor triggers based on the formalization of triggers and the identified inner behaviors of backdoor models from our analysis.

item.title: Structured prompt interrogation and recursive extraction of semantics (SPIRES): A method for populating knowledge bases using zero-shot learning
item.description: Creating knowledge bases and ontologies is a time consuming task that relies on a manual curation.

item.title: The Saudi Privacy Policy Dataset
item.description: This paper introduces the Saudi Privacy Policy Dataset, a diverse compilation of Arabic privacy policies from various sectors in Saudi Arabia, annotated according to the 10 principles of the Personal Data Protection Law (PDPL); the PDPL was established to be compatible with General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR); one of the most comprehensive data regulations worldwide.

item.title: Efficient Deduplication and Leakage Detection in Large Scale Image Datasets with a focus on the CrowdAI Mapping Challenge Dataset
item.description: The CrowdAI Mapping Challenge Dataset is one of these datasets that has been used extensively in recent years to train deep neural networks.

item.title: Learning Knowledge-Rich Sequential Model for Planar Homography Estimation in Aerial Video
item.description: To address this concern, we develop a sequential estimator that directly processes a sequence of video frames and estimates their pairwise planar homographic transformations in batches.

item.title: Evaluation of ChatGPT Family of Models for Biomedical Reasoning and Classification
item.description: The first task is classifying whether statements of clinical and policy recommendations in scientific literature constitute health advice.

item.title: Low-Shot Learning for Fictional Claim Verification
item.description: In this paper, we study the problem of claim verification in the context of claims about fictional stories in a low-shot learning setting.

item.title: EigenFold: Generative Protein Structure Prediction with Diffusion Models
item.description: Protein structure prediction has reached revolutionary levels of accuracy on single structures, yet distributional modeling paradigms are needed to capture the conformational ensembles and flexibility that underlie biological function.

item.title: BiFormer: Learning Bilateral Motion Estimation via Bilateral Transformer for 4K Video Frame Interpolation
item.description: First, in global motion estimation, we predict symmetric bilateral motion fields at a coarse scale.

item.title: Semantic Validation in Structure from Motion
item.description: Furthermore, semantic labels on input images are used for the removal of objects associated with motion in the output SfM models.

item.title: On the Impact of Voice Anonymization on Speech-Based COVID-19 Detection
item.description: With advances seen in deep learning, voice-based applications are burgeoning, ranging from personal assistants, affective computing, to remote disease diagnostics.

item.title: ParroT: Translating During Chat Using Large Language Models
item.description: Therefore, we propose the $\mathbf{ParroT}$ framework to enhance and regulate the translation abilities during chat based on open-sourced LLMs (i. e., LLaMA-7b) and human written translation and evaluation data.

item.title: MoStGAN-V: Video Generation with Temporal Motion Styles
item.description: Video generation remains a challenging task due to spatiotemporal complexity and the requirement of synthesizing diverse motions with temporal consistency.

item.title: Selecting Features by their Resilience to the Curse of Dimensionality
item.description: Real-world datasets are often of high dimension and effected by the curse of dimensionality.

item.title: Shape complexity estimation using VAE
item.description: In this paper, we compare methods for estimating the complexity of two-dimensional shapes and introduce a method that exploits reconstruction loss of Variational Autoencoders with different sizes of latent vectors.

item.title: MS3D: Leveraging Multiple Detectors for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation in 3D Object Detection
item.description: Our proposed Kernel-Density Estimation (KDE) Box Fusion method fuses box proposals from multiple domains to obtain pseudo-labels that surpass the performance of the best source domain detectors.

item.title: A dynamic Bayesian optimized active recommender system for curiosity-driven Human-in-the-loop automated experiments
item.description: Optimization of experimental materials synthesis and characterization through active learning methods has been growing over the last decade, with examples ranging from measurements of diffraction on combinatorial alloys at synchrotrons, to searches through chemical space with automated synthesis robots for perovskites.

item.title: Multi-annotator Deep Learning: A Probabilistic Framework for Classification
item.description: Training standard deep neural networks leads to subpar performances in such multi-annotator supervised learning settings.

item.title: Self-Distillation for Gaussian Process Regression and Classification
item.description: We propose two approaches to extend the notion of knowledge distillation to Gaussian Process Regression (GPR) and Gaussian Process Classification (GPC); data-centric and distribution-centric.

item.title: Industrial Anomaly Detection with Domain Shift: A Real-world Dataset and Masked Multi-scale Reconstruction
item.description: In this paper, to bridge this gap, we propose the Aero-engine Blade Anomaly Detection (AeBAD) dataset, consisting of two sub-datasets: the single-blade dataset and the video anomaly detection dataset of blades.

item.title: MoocRadar: A Fine-grained and Multi-aspect Knowledge Repository for Improving Cognitive Student Modeling in MOOCs
item.description: Student modeling, the task of inferring a student's learning characteristics through their interactions with coursework, is a fundamental issue in intelligent education.

item.title: HNeRV: A Hybrid Neural Representation for Videos
item.description: Such embedding largely limits the regression capacity and internal generalization for video interpolation.

item.title: How to choose your best allies for a transferable attack?
item.description: The transferability of adversarial examples is a key issue in the security of deep neural networks.

item.title: A Certified Radius-Guided Attack Framework to Image Segmentation Models
item.description: We are the first, from the attacker perspective, to leverage the properties of certified radius and propose a certified radius guided attack framework against image segmentation models.
